title: Finley Malloc
text:
Finley Malloc is the Chief Data Scientist at Wengo Analytics. When not innovating on data platforms, Finley enjoys spending time unicycling and playing with her pet iguana.


University of California, San Diego | San Diego, CA PhD in Mathematics | Sept 2011 - June 2015
Macalester College | St.¬†Paul MA B.A in Economics | Sept 2007 - June 2011



Wengo Analytics | Head Data Scientist | April 2018 - present
GeoScynce | Chief Analyst | Sept 2012 - April 2018

title: Visual Analytics for Camelot Caves Inc.¬†(CCI)
text:
Case ‚ÄúCamelot Caves Inc.¬†(CCI)‚Äù is created and designed by:

Barbara Sainty
Staci Kenno
Jianyuan(Andy) Hu

I really take the pleasure to work with Barbara and Staci to heart and contribute to a modern accounting education.
Please note

This page does not contain the full solution for CCI case.
This page has a suggested visual analytics solution for CCI case. It only serves as a guidence, and it by no means a definitive or the only solution. It has both Power BI and Tableau version, in case students would like to learn either of the tools.

Please see ‚ÄúSpecial Credits‚Äù page of the report for full credits and acknowledgements.

Power BITableau


For Power BI version, please following the link here: Camelot Caves Inc.¬†Power BI


For best Tableau viewing experience, please following the link here: Camelot Caves Inc.¬†Tableau

title: Welcome!!! üéâüéâ
text:
My name is Jianyuan(most people will know me as Andy) Hu. TDLR, I am a CPA and am now quite active as an analytics engineer. Once again thank you for paying me a visit.

If you are interested in knowing more about me, please continue to ‚ÄúMore About Me‚Äù. Or,
If you are interested in what I have been working on and you can find all of it under the ‚ÄúProject Gallery‚Äù on the left navigation panel.




I am glad that you are interested in me enough to read along here. I am a CPA, so by trade, that makes me an accountant.
That said, I‚Äôm a data nerd, too. Occasionally, I make a bunch of funny names like R, Python, SQL, Excel, Microsoft Fabric (including Power BI), Tableau etc. all dance together so that people can make the best out of their data. People also call me analytics engineer at times. I‚Äôm a big in the magic when you mix classic accounting with modern analytics ‚Äì it‚Äôs like peanut butter and jelly, but for business.
Education is a BIG deal to me. I love helping others to grow. When I‚Äôm not nerding out things, you can find me in the classroom, teaching courses at colleges/universities/professional associations. Subjects vary: accounting, statistics, data tool stacks, you name it.
I am leaving my LinkedIn contact right below. If you believe I can make your life better in anyways, or if you like exchange ideas, let‚Äôs connect! ü§ù

 
  
   
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Github
